00111 
00115     int test;
00116     
00124     typedef enum { ok, fail, ex, warn, term, ex_ctor } result_type;
00125     result_type result;
00126 
00130     std::string message;
00131     std::string exception_typeid;

00137       : test(0),result(ok)
00138     {
00139     }

00145       : group(grp),test(pos),result(res)
00146     {

00155       : group(grp),test(pos),result(res),

00165   struct group_base
00166   {
00167     virtual ~group_base(){};
00168 
00169     // Finalization for group.
00170     virtual void group_completed() = 0;
00171 
00172     // execute tests iteratively
00173     virtual void rewind() = 0;
00174     virtual test_result run_next() = 0;
00175 
00176     // execute one test
00177     virtual test_result run_test(int n) = 0;

00220   class test_runner
00221   {
00222     protected:
00223       typedef std::map<std::string,group_base*> groups;
00224       typedef groups::iterator iterator;
00225       typedef groups::const_iterator const_iterator;
00226       groups groups_;
00227 
00228       callback  default_callback_;
00229       callback* callback_;
00230 
00231     public:
00235     test_runner() : callback_(&default_callback_)
00236     {
00237     }
00238 
00242     void register_group(const std::string& name,group_base* gr)
00243     {
00244       if( gr == 0 )
00245       {
00246         throw std::invalid_argument("group shall be non-null");
00247       }
00248 
00249       groups::iterator found = groups_.find(name);
00250       if( found != groups_.end() )
00251       {
00252         std::string msg("attempt to add already existent group "+name);
00253         // this exception terminates application so we use cerr also
00254         std::cerr << msg << std::endl;
00255         throw std::logic_error(msg);
00256       }
00257 
00258       groups_[name] = gr;
00259     }
00260 
00264     void set_callback(callback* cb)
00265     {
00266       callback_ = cb==0? &default_callback_:cb;
00267     }
00268 
00272     callback& get_callback() const
00273     {
00274       return *callback_;
00275     }

00280     const groupnames list_groups() const
00281     {
00282       groupnames ret;
00283       const_iterator i = groups_.begin();
00284       const_iterator e = groups_.end();
00285       while( i != e )
00286       {
00287         ret.push_back(i->first);
00288         ++i;
00289       }
00290       return ret;
00291     }
00292 
00297     void run_tests() const
00298     {
00299       callback_->run_started();
00300 
00301       const_iterator i = groups_.begin();
00302       const_iterator e = groups_.end();
00303       while( i != e )
00304       {
00305         try
00306         {
00307           run_all_tests_in_group_(i);
00308         }
00309         catch( const no_more_tests& )
00310         {
00311           // ok
00312           i->second->group_completed();
00313         }
00314 
00315         ++i;
00316       }
00317 
00318       callback_->run_completed();
00319     }
00320 
00324     void run_tests(const std::string& group_name) const
00325     {
00326       callback_->run_started();
00327 
00328       const_iterator i = groups_.find(group_name);
00329       if( i == groups_.end() )
00330       {
00331         throw no_such_group(group_name);
00332       }
00333 
00334       try
00335       {
00336         run_all_tests_in_group_(i);
00337       }
00338       catch( const no_more_tests& )
00339       {
00340         // ok
00341         i->second->group_completed();
00342       }
00343 
00344       callback_->run_completed();
00345     }
00346 
00350     test_result run_test(const std::string& group_name,int n) const
00351     {
00352       callback_->run_started();
00353 
00354       const_iterator i = groups_.find(group_name);
00355       if( i == groups_.end() )
00356       {
00357         throw no_such_group(group_name);
00358       }
00359 
00360       try
00361       {
00362         test_result tr = i->second->run_test(n);
00363         callback_->test_completed(tr);
00364         i->second->group_completed();
00365         callback_->run_completed();
00366         return tr;
00367       }
00368       catch( const beyond_last_test& )
00369       {
00370         callback_->run_completed();
00371         throw;
00372       }      
00373       catch( const no_such_test& )
00374       {
00375         callback_->run_completed();
00376         throw;
00377       }
00378     }
00379 
00380     private:
00381     void run_all_tests_in_group_(const_iterator i) const
00382     {
00383       i->second->rewind();
00384       for( ;; )
00385       {
00386         test_result tr = i->second->run_next();
00387         callback_->test_completed(tr);
00388 
00389         if( tr.result == test_result::ex_ctor )
00390         {
00391           throw no_more_tests();
00392         }
00393       }
00394     }
00395   };

00452     void ensure(bool cond)
00453     {
00454        if( !cond ) throw failure("");
00455     }

00461     template<typename T>
00462     void ensure(const T msg,bool cond)
00463     {
00464        if( !cond ) throw failure(msg);
00465     }

00474     template <class T,class Q>
00475     void ensure_equals(const char* msg,const Q& actual,const T& expected)
00476     {
00477       if( expected != actual )
00478       {
00479         std::stringstream ss;
00480         ss << (msg?msg:"") << (msg?": ":"") << "expected " << expected << " actual " << actual;
00481         throw failure(ss.str().c_str());
00482       }
00483     }
00484 
00485     template <class T,class Q>
00486     void ensure_equals(const Q& actual,const T& expected)
00487     {
00488       ensure_equals<>(0,actual,expected);
00489     }
00490 
00498     template <class T,class Q>
00499     void ensure_lessthan(const char* msg,const Q& lesser,const T& greater)
00500     {
00501       if ( ! (lesser<greater) )
00502       {
00503         std::stringstream ss;
00504         ss << (msg?msg:"") << (msg?": ":"") << "expected " << lesser
00505            << " < " << greater;
00506         throw failure(ss.str().c_str());
00507       }
00508     }
00509 
00510     template <class T,class Q>
00511     void ensure_lessthan(const Q& lesser,const T& greater)
00512     {
00513       ensure_lessthan<>(0,lesser,greater);
00514     }
00515 
00523     template <class T,class Q>
00524     void ensure_greaterthan(const char* msg,const Q& greater,const T& lesser)
00525     {
00526       if ( ! (greater>lesser) )
00527       {
00528         std::stringstream ss;
00529         ss << (msg?msg:"") << (msg?": ":"") << "expected " << greater
00530            << " > " << lesser;
00531         throw failure(ss.str().c_str());
00532       }
00533     }

00536     void ensure_greaterthan(const Q& greater,const T& lesser)
00537     {

00539     }

00550     template <class T>
00551     void ensure_distance(const char* msg,const T& actual,const T& expected,const T& distance)
00552     {
00553       if( expected-distance >= actual || expected+distance <= actual )
00554       {
00555         std::stringstream ss;
00556         ss << (msg?msg:"") << (msg?": ":"") << "expected [" << expected-distance << ";" 
00557            << expected+distance << "] actual " << actual;
00558         throw failure(ss.str().c_str());
00559       }
00560     }
00561 
00562     template <class T>
00563     void ensure_distance(const T& actual,const T& expected,const T& distance)
00564     {
00565       ensure_distance<>(0,actual,expected,distance);
00566     }

00571     void fail(const char* msg="")

00573       throw failure(msg);

00581   template <class Test,class Group,int n>
00582   struct tests_registerer
00583   {
00584     static void reg(Group& group)
00585     {
00586       group.reg(n,&Test::template test<n>);
00587       tests_registerer<Test,Group,n-1>::reg(group);
00588     }
00589   };
00590 
00591   template<class Test,class Group>
00592   struct tests_registerer<Test,Group,0>
00593   {
00594     static void reg(Group&){};
00595   };
00596 
00602   template <class Data,int MaxTestsInGroup = 50>
00603   class test_group : public group_base
00604   {
00605     const char* name_;
00606 
00607     typedef void (test_object<Data>::*testmethod)();
00608     typedef std::map<int,testmethod> tests;
00609     typedef typename tests::iterator tests_iterator;
00610     typedef typename tests::const_iterator tests_const_iterator;
00611     typedef typename tests::const_reverse_iterator 
00612                      tests_const_reverse_iterator;
00613     typedef typename tests::size_type size_type;
00614 
00615     typedef void (*groupfinalization)();
00616 
00617     tests tests_;
00618     tests_iterator current_test_;
00619     groupfinalization group_finalization_;
00620 
00624     template <class T>
00625     class safe_holder
00626     {
00627       T* p_;
00628       bool permit_throw_in_dtor;
00629 
00630       safe_holder(const safe_holder&);
00631       safe_holder& operator = (const safe_holder&);
00632 
00633       public:
00634       safe_holder() : p_(0),permit_throw_in_dtor(false)
00635       { 
00636       }
00637 
00638       ~safe_holder()
00639       {
00640         release();
00641       }
00642 
00643       T* operator -> () const { return p_; };
00644       T* get() const { return p_; };
00645 
00651       void permit_throw(){ permit_throw_in_dtor = true; }
00652 
00659       void release()
00660       {
00661         try
00662         {
00663           if( delete_obj() == false )
00664           {
00665             throw warning("destructor of test object raised an SEH exception");
00666           }
00667         }
00668         catch( const std::exception& ex )
00669         {
00670           if( permit_throw_in_dtor ) 
00671           {
00672             std::string msg = "destructor of test object raised exception: ";
00673             msg += ex.what();
00674             throw warning(msg);
00675           }
00676         }
00677         catch( ... )
00678         {
00679           if( permit_throw_in_dtor )
00680           {
00681             throw warning("destructor of test object raised an exception");
00682           }
00683         }
00684       }
00685 
00689       void reset()
00690       {
00691         release();
00692         permit_throw_in_dtor = false;
00693         p_ = new T();
00694       }
00695 
00696       bool delete_obj()
00697       {
00698 #if defined(TUT_USE_SEH)
00699         __try
00700         {
00701 #endif
00702           T* p = p_; 
00703           p_ = 0;
00704           delete p;
00705 #if defined(TUT_USE_SEH)
00706         }
00707         __except(handle_seh_(::GetExceptionCode()))
00708         {
00709           if( permit_throw_in_dtor )
00710           {
00711             return false;
00712           }
00713         }
00714 #endif
00715         return true;
00716       }
00717     };
00718 
00719     public:
00720     typedef test_object<Data> object;    
00721 
00725     test_group(const char* name, groupfinalization final = NULL)
00726       : name_(name), group_finalization_(final)
00727     {
00728       // register itself
00729       runner.get().register_group(name_,this);
00730     
00731       // register all tests
00732       tests_registerer<object,test_group,MaxTestsInGroup>::reg(*this);
00733     };
00734 
00738     test_group(const char* name, test_runner& another_runner)
00739       : name_(name), group_finalization_(NULL)
00740     {
00741       // register itself
00742       another_runner.register_group(name_,this); 
00743     
00744       // register all tests
00745       tests_registerer<test_object<Data>,
00746                        test_group,MaxTestsInGroup>::reg(*this);
00747     };
00748 
00752     void reg(int n,testmethod tm)
00753     {
00754       tests_[n] = tm;
00755     }
00756 
00760     void rewind()
00761     {
00762       current_test_ = tests_.begin();
00763     }
00764 
00768     test_result run_next()
00769     {
00770       if( current_test_ == tests_.end() )
00771       {
00772         throw no_more_tests();
00773       }
00774 
00775       // find next user-specialized test
00776       safe_holder<object> obj;
00777       while( current_test_ != tests_.end() )
00778       {
00779         try
00780         {
00781           return run_test_(current_test_++,obj);
00782         }
00783         catch( const no_such_test& )
00784         {
00785           continue; 
00786         }
00787       } 
00788 
00789       throw no_more_tests();
00790     }
00791 
00795     test_result run_test(int n)
00796     {
00797       // beyond tests is special case to discover upper limit
00798       if( tests_.rbegin() == tests_.rend() ) throw beyond_last_test();
00799       if( tests_.rbegin()->first < n ) throw beyond_last_test();
00800 
00801       // withing scope; check if given test exists
00802       tests_iterator ti = tests_.find(n);
00803       if( ti == tests_.end() ) throw no_such_test();
00804 
00805       safe_holder<object> obj;
00806       return run_test_(ti,obj);
00807     }
00808 
00809     void group_completed() {
00810       if (group_finalization_ != NULL) group_finalization_();
00811     }
00812 
00813   private:
00818     test_result run_test_(const tests_iterator& ti,safe_holder<object>& obj)
00819     {
00820       try
00821       {
00822         if( run_test_seh_(ti->second,obj) == false )
00823           throw seh("seh");
00824       }
00825       catch(const no_such_test&)
00826       {
00827         throw;
00828       }
00829       catch(const warning& ex)
00830       {
00831         // test ok, but destructor failed
00832         test_result tr(name_,ti->first,test_result::warn,ex);
00833         return tr;
00834       }
00835       catch(const failure& ex)
00836       {
00837         // test failed because of ensure() or similar method
00838         test_result tr(name_,ti->first,test_result::fail,ex);
00839         return tr;
00840       }
00841       catch(const seh& ex)
00842       {
00843         // test failed with sigsegv, divide by zero, etc
00844         test_result tr(name_,ti->first,test_result::term,ex);
00845         return tr;
00846       }
00847       catch(const bad_ctor& ex)
00848       {
00849         // test failed because test ctor failed; stop the whole group
00850         test_result tr(name_,ti->first,test_result::ex_ctor,ex);
00851         return tr;
00852       }
00853       catch(const std::exception& ex)
00854       {
00855         // test failed with std::exception
00856         test_result tr(name_,ti->first,test_result::ex,ex);
00857         return tr;
00858       }
00859       catch(...)
00860       {
00861         // test failed with unknown exception
00862         test_result tr(name_,ti->first,test_result::ex);
00863         return tr;
00864       }
00865 
00866       // test passed
00867       test_result tr(name_,ti->first,test_result::ok);
00868       return tr;
00869     }
00870 
00874     bool run_test_seh_(testmethod tm,safe_holder<object>& obj)
00875     {
00876 #if defined(TUT_USE_SEH)
00877       __try
00878       {
00879 #endif
00880         if( obj.get() == 0 ) 
00881         {
00882           reset_holder_(obj);
00883         }
00884         obj->called_method_was_a_dummy_test_ = false;
00885 
00886 #if defined(TUT_USE_SEH)
00887         __try
00888         {
00889 #endif
00890           (obj.get()->*tm)();
00891 #if defined(TUT_USE_SEH)
00892         }
00893         __except(handle_seh_(::GetExceptionCode()))
00894         {
00895           // throw seh("SEH");
00896           return false;
00897         }
00898 #endif
00899 
00900         if( obj->called_method_was_a_dummy_test_ )
00901         {
00902           // do not call obj.release(); reuse object
00903           throw no_such_test();
00904         }
00905 
00906         obj.permit_throw();
00907         obj.release();
00908 #if defined(TUT_USE_SEH)
00909       }
00910       __except(handle_seh_(::GetExceptionCode()))
00911       {
00912         return false;
00913       }
00914 #endif
00915       return true;
00916     }
00917 
00918     void reset_holder_(safe_holder<object>& obj)
00919     {
00920       try 
00921       {
00922         obj.reset();
00923       }
00924       catch(const std::exception& ex)
00925       {
00926         throw bad_ctor(ex.what());
00927       }
00928       catch(...)
00929       {
00930         throw bad_ctor("test constructor has generated an exception; group execution is terminated");
00931       }
00932     }
00933   };
00934 
00935 #if defined(TUT_USE_SEH)
00936 
00939   inline int handle_seh_(DWORD excode)
00940   {
00941     switch(excode)
00942     {
00943       case EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION:
00944       case EXCEPTION_DATATYPE_MISALIGNMENT:
00945       case EXCEPTION_BREAKPOINT:
00946       case EXCEPTION_SINGLE_STEP:
00947       case EXCEPTION_ARRAY_BOUNDS_EXCEEDED:
00948       case EXCEPTION_FLT_DENORMAL_OPERAND:     
00949       case EXCEPTION_FLT_DIVIDE_BY_ZERO:
00950       case EXCEPTION_FLT_INEXACT_RESULT:        
00951       case EXCEPTION_FLT_INVALID_OPERATION:
00952       case EXCEPTION_FLT_OVERFLOW:
00953       case EXCEPTION_FLT_STACK_CHECK:
00954       case EXCEPTION_FLT_UNDERFLOW:
00955       case EXCEPTION_INT_DIVIDE_BY_ZERO:
00956       case EXCEPTION_INT_OVERFLOW:
00957       case EXCEPTION_PRIV_INSTRUCTION:
00958       case EXCEPTION_IN_PAGE_ERROR:
00959       case EXCEPTION_ILLEGAL_INSTRUCTION:
00960       case EXCEPTION_NONCONTINUABLE_EXCEPTION:
00961       case EXCEPTION_STACK_OVERFLOW:
00962       case EXCEPTION_INVALID_DISPOSITION:
00963       case EXCEPTION_GUARD_PAGE:
00964       case EXCEPTION_INVALID_HANDLE:
00965         return EXCEPTION_EXECUTE_HANDLER;
00966     };    
00967 
00968     return EXCEPTION_CONTINUE_SEARCH;
00969   }
00970 #endif
00971 }
00972 
00973 #endif
